ุงูู ูู ุทุจูุนุฉ ุงุฎุชุจุงุฑุงุช: What is the nature of the admission tests and the personal interview?
- ู ุจุฏุฃูุง ูุฏุฉ ุฃุญุจ ุฃุทู ููู: - Initially, I want to assure you that the admission tests are not difficult, the questions are not impossible, and you won't be required to solve 200 questions in half an hour. Generally, the questions will cover math, English, and Arabic language, and they will be at the level of a third-year preparatory student. This is very normal and quite okay, especially since you are in the third year of preparatory school. You'll be asked about things you've studied before, so don't worry. You don't need a specialized course for the tests or the personal interview. You can take a course, but make it for your personal growth. Learn something new for yourself, like a new language or programming, or get an idea about different fields and technologies. At WE, you will learn that your education is not just about exams and grades. Exams are an evaluation of your academic achievement, but remember that you are learning for yourself and constantly improving. ๐
- ุจู ุง ุงู ุงูู ูุงูุฌ ุนูุฏูุง: - Since our curriculum is of a high and distinguished level, it's necessary for those who teach it to be professional engineers, teachers, and experienced professors in their specialized fields. They should have a good understanding of the current job market and practical life experiences. You'll find them explaining the subjects with professionalism, and their primary and ultimate goal is to ensure your understanding. They don't get tired of questions; on the contrary, they love questions and are eager to answer them in their field of expertise. Depending on their practical experience, they'll even answer questions that may go beyond the curriculum. What's important to them is your learning. They won't hesitate to share knowledge with you. If you face difficulties, they'll be the first ones by your side, supporting and encouraging you. They put in great and commendable effort, always having a smile on their faces. They genuinely care about you, love you, and are concerned about your well-being. No matter how much we talk about them, words can't fully describe our feelings towards them. You might think it's just words, but you'll feel all of this if you go through this experience. You'll realize it's not just words; it's the outcome of a real experience... an irreplaceable experience. ๐
ุฃูุง ู ู ู ุฏุฑุณุฉ ุนุฑุจู ุูู ุ: I am from an Arabic school. Will this affect me, especially since I learned that the subjects are in English?

All of us encounter terminology we've never seen before. However, with time, you'll quickly get used to it, and you won't face any problems. Just like students in language schools, it all comes down to your dedication and efforts, along with the support from the engineers and teachers. They will start with you step by step until you become accustomed.
